https://github.com/oryband/vim/blob/master/vimrc - For Python/Django/HTML/CSS/JS. With comments.

OK, I just did a huuuuuuuuuge overhaul & refactured everything in my vimrc. All plugins are installed via a plugin manager (with git behind-the-scenes). Also renamed the repo. Here's my new .vimrc: https://github.com/oryband/dotvim/blob/master/vimrc Check the repo itself also.
Just commented most things in mine: https://github.com/xoebus/dotfiles/blob/master/vimrc
pardon the overly-optimistic description of the "project"

i just checked out janus and it's pretty amazing -- all the hard work done for you by someone who has much more time than you to spend configuring your vimrc :)
@durdn That's the most amazing vim setup I've ever come across

and so mine... https://bitbucket.org/sharat87/vimfiles
Here are my dotfiles: https://github.com/claytron/dotfiles complete with pentadactyl settings :)
@claytron I like your little installer script, that could save me time aplenty!

If you like plugin managers, you should try Vundle (https://github.com/gmarik/vundle). This thing is amazing. It's based on Pathogen, but let you manage all of your plugins within your .vimrc . You can view an example in my .vimrc (url at the top lines of this thread).
https://github.com/jmcantrell/dotfiles-vim

Vundle looks interesting, but, if I remember correctly, it only allows adding plugins from either vim.org or a git repo. Some of the plugins I use come from hg repos. The solution I came up with allows you to add plugins from any VCS.
@jmcantrell Yes, but also from http://vim-scripts.org . However, you can always fork the hg repos to your git and load them from Vundle.
Finally got my vimrc into an acceptable state: https://github.com/mal/dotfiles/blob/master/.vimrc
https://github.com/zerok/vimconfig :-) No using pathogen and git submodules :D
https://github.com/ricobl/dotfiles/tree/master/dotfiles

I've been using homesick (http://rubygems.org/gems/homesick) to setup and share my vimrc and other dotfiles. Makes it really easy to use them on a bunch of machines. My vimrc is basically the same as the one from the peepcode screencasts so not that original. You can see it at https://github.com/MarkBennett/MarkBennett-vim if your curious.
Well, I guess there is absolutely nothing special about my dotfiles. But who cares :) https://github.com/narqo/dot_files
